instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.CHGR_CSI_N: What is CHGR_CSI_N? CHGR_CSI_N is one of the current sense lines for the charger. Resistance between CHGR_CSI_N and CHGR_CSI_P should be the resistance should be the total series resistance of the current sense resistors in the circuit, usually about 20.02 ohms.
definitions.CHGR_CSI_P: What is CHGR_CSI_P? CHGR_CSI_P is one of the current sense lines for the charger. Resistance between CHGR_CSI_P and CHGR_CSI_N should be the resistance should be the total series resistance of the current sense resistors in the circuit, usually about 20.02 ohms.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b faint green light
threads.message:
Sup everyone, I have said board with a faint light, was not liquid damaged or anything. Getting ~1.75v <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>. Tested <TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR> & <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>, got ~1v going to pin 4 of <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR> but 0v going to pin 4 <TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR>. Replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and still no <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> (any higher). Resistance between <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> pins 28 & 27 is ~20ohms, pins 17 & 18 ~2.2ohms. 

<SIGNAL>CHGR_CSI_P</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>CHGR_CSI_N</SIGNAL> are getting ~16.5v (should be enough right?)

I'm thinking it's a fried SMC? The SMC looks to have two little bulges on the surface of it, is that indicative of damage?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b faint green light
threads.message: First thing to check would be PP3V42

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b faint green light
threads.message: PP3v42 comes out at a steady 115mv

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b faint green light
threads.message: Come on, what do you check next? Short

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b faint green light
threads.message: Sorry since my last post ive been just working on the board, I didnt meant to leave such a short reply. There was a short on <CHIP>U6990</CHIP> which would drop voltage from pp18v5 to like 10v, replaced and voltage was steady pre-<CHIP>U6990</CHIP> but 0v on pp3v42. Went ahead and replaced the SMC because fuck it why not right? And I got pp3v42 now. But I'm still not getting any g3h, and now <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> isn't sending voltage to <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b faint green light
threads.message: I honestly figured the SMC was at least bad because it had bubbled on the surface, not just replacing to replace. Also I'm not sure how to check for a short on pp3v42 after <CHIP>U6990</CHIP> since all I've ever seen is "put a psu through it and see what heats up"

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b faint green light
threads.message: So 3V42 is now present? Got a green light now? If not is ACOK present?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b faint green light
threads.message: no green light, acok is not present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b faint green light
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b faint green light
threads.message: replaced it with a good one and nope, still no acok

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b faint green light
threads.message: Still no green light???? Check the soldering job..... voltage on ACIN?? Have you tried another magsafe??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b faint green light
threads.message:
I've tried another magsafe, I've got 4v at ac-in. Solder is good on the ISL, I'm thinking maybe I gotta redo the SMC if there's a short on acok? I hope that's not what it is but I guess it's a possibility.

EDIT: Tested for a short to ground, nope! All good here.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b faint green light
threads.message: Is the pull up resistor on the ACOK line good? <RESISTOR>R5087</RESISTOR>. Also check <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR>.
